intro: Terminalia discolor, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by distinctive, elongated, yellowish fruits. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Terminalia discolor is valued for its hard, durable wood and has traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
